info.title: Policies
info.description: Create and manage policies that control user access to infrastructure and cloud resources.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter query to retrieve access policies. Supported operations: eq (except Identities which supports only contains), or, and. If you want to query on the same field, use "or" condition. Use the "and" operation to filter on two fields or more. Supported field names: policyTags, identities, targetCategory, status, locationType.

schema.example: filter=(((policyTags eq 'a') or (policyTags eq 'b') or (policyTags eq 'c')) and (identities contains 'identity1234') and (targetCategory eq 'VM') and ((status eq 'suspend') or (status eq 'active')) and ((locationType eq 'Azure') or (locationType eq 'GCP')))

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The maximum number of access policies to return.
You can request up to 50 policies.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The field name by which to sort the results.
Currently results can be sorted by "createdBy" only.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description:
The token from the previous API response.
To retrieve the next N results, use DS1_10;DS2_20.
This means that the service will retrieve 10 results from DS_1 and 20 results from DS_2.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Use this for a free text search on **policy name** and **description**.

RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period.

get.description: Returns the details about a specific access policy

post.description:
Triggers a policy validation.
If the response is "Validating", then you need to call the Get policy API to check the final status.

* Relevant for cloud console policies only.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the service you are querying to determine if it is managed in UAP. Possible values - sca, sia

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Internal parameter that will be valid only when providing internal token

parameters.name: identityId
parameters.description: Internal parameter that will be valid only when providing internal token

post.description: When the API is triggered, policy management in the Administration space (UAP) will be enables on the service and tenant level.
API to rollback the transition of a standalone access policy to UAP

CommonAccessPolicy.description: Fields common to all access policies

targetCategory.description:
The category of the target:
- **Cloud access**: Cloud Console - **Infrastructure access:** VM, DB

locationType.description:
The location of the target:
- **Cloud access:** AWS, Azure, GCP
- **Instrastructure access:** FQDN/IP

policyType.description:
The type of policy - recurring or on-demand.
Default - Recurring

id.description: The unique identifier of the identity in CyberArk. An identity is a user, group, or role

sourceDirectoryName.description:
The name of the directory service.
If the type is ROLE, then this field is optional.

sourceDirectoryId.description:
The unique identifier of the directory service.
If the type is ROLE, then this field is optional.

TimeCondition.title: TimeCondition

daysOfTheWeek.description: The days of the week to include in the policy's access, where Sunday=0, Monday=1,..., Saturday=6

fromHour.description: The start time of the policy's access window

toHour.description: The end time of the policy's access window

TimeCondition.description: The days and times when the user can connect to their target using this policy

Conditions.title: Conditions

maxSessionDuration.description:
The maximum length of time a user can remain connected in a single session.
Maximum: * 12 hours for Cloud Access * 24 hours for VM and DB Access

Conditions.description: The allowed session length, and the access window (days and times) during which a session can be started.

idleTime.description: The maximum idle time (in minutes) before the session ends

InfrastructureVirtualMachineTarget.title: InfrastructureVirtualMachineTarget
InfrastructureVirtualMachineTarget.description: Details of VM targets per location.

CloudConsoleTarget.title: CloudConsoleTarget
CloudConsoleTarget.description: The types of cloud consoles that you can connect to

roleId.description: The unique identifier assigned to the IAM role in AWS (IAM role ARN)

workspaceId.description: The ID given to the standalone AWS account workspace when it was oboarded to CyberArk

roleId.description: The unique identifier assigned to the IAM role in AWS (IAM role ARN)

orgId.description: Management account ID (required only for AWS IAM Identity Center)

workspaceId.description: The ID given to the AWS organization workspace when it was oboarded to CyberArk

roleId.description: The identifier of Azure resource role or Entra ID role
roleId.example: For Azure resource role: /subscriptions/xxxxxxx/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c025889f-8102-4ebf-b32c-fc0c6f0c6bd9. For EntraId roles, provide the Guid of the role - c025889f-8102-4ebf-b32c-fc0c6f0c6bd9

workspaceId.description: The ID given to the Microsoft Entra ID workspace when it was oboarded to CyberArk

workspaceType.description: The level at which the Microsoft Entra ID workspace was onboarded to CyberArk

Example 1.roleId: For Azure resource role: /subscriptions/xxxxxxx/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c025889f-8102-4ebf-b32c-fc0c6f0c6bd9. For EntraId roles, provide the Guid of the role - c025889f-8102-4ebf-b32c-fc0c6f0c6bd9

groupName.description: Display name of the Azure AD group

groupType.description: Type of the Azure AD group

roleId.description: The Google Cloud role and hierarchy structure

workspaceId.description: The ID given to the Google Cloud workspace when it was oboarded to CyberArk

workspaceType.description: The level at which the Google Cloud organiztion workspace was onboarded to CyberArk

nextToken.description:
The token from the previous API response.
To retrieve the next N results, use DS1_10;DS2_20.
This means that the service will retrieve 10 results from DS_1 and 20 results from DS_2.

policyId.description: The unique identifier of the access policy

is_service_active.description:
Indicates whether or not the service is managed in the Administration space.
false: The service is not managed in UAP
true: The service is managed in UAP

serviceName.description: The name of the service you are querying to determine if the policy is managed in the Administration space. Possible values - sca, sia
The name of the service you are querying to determine if it is managed in UAP. Possible values - sca, sia

soft.description: Set to false if you would like the rollback to delete the synced policies. Default is true, meaning, UAP not delete the policies, it just disabled for the service.

dryRun.description: If true, performs a validation without persisting the policy

fromTime.description: The date the policy becomes active

CommonAccessPolicy_metadata_timeFrame.description:
The timeframe that the policy is active.
For an unlimited timeframe, leave empty.

policyId.description: The unique identifier of the access policy

name.description: A unique name for the access policy.

description.description: A short description about the policy - maximum 200 characters

policyTags.description:
Customized tags to help identify the policy and those similar to it
Maximum 20 tags per policy

timeZone.description:
The time zone identifier
Example: (Europe/London) Default: GMT

regions.description:
AWS region names. For example: "us-east-1".
To list all regions, leave empty.

tags.description:
A list of key-value pairs that have been defined as custom tags for your AWS instances.
To list all tags, leave empty.

vpcIds_copy.description:
A list of AWS VPC IDs. The accepted syntax is "vpc-".
To list all VPCs, leave empty.

vpcIds.description:
A list of AWS VPC IDs. The accepted syntax is "vpc-".
To list all VPCs, leave empty.

accountIds.description:
AWS account IDs.
To list all AWS accounts, leave empty.

regions.description:
Azure region names. For example: eastus2.
To list all regions, leave empty.

tags.description:
A list of key-value pairs that have been defined as custom tags for your Azure VMs.
To list all tags, leave empty.

resourceGroups.description:
A list of Azure resource group IDs.
To list all Azure resource groups, leave empty.

vnetIds.description:
A list of Azure VNet IDs.
To list all Azure VNet IDs, leave empty.

subscriptions.description:
Azure subscription IDs.
To list all Azure subscriptions, leave empty.

labels.description:
A list of key-value pairs that have been defined as custom labels for your GCP VMs.
To list all labels, leave empty.

regions.description:
A list of GCP region names. For example: us-east1.
To list all regions, leave empty.

vpcIds.description:
A list of GCP VPC IDs.
Accepted syntax: "projects/{project_id}/global/networks/{network_name}".
To list all VPCs, leave empty.

projects.description:
A list of GCP project IDs.
To list all projects, leave empty.

computernamePattern.description: The pattern in relation to the operator.

domain.description: The domain in which to execute the operator on the pattern.

ipAddresses.description: The IP address that matches the logical network name.

logicalName.description: The logical network name that matches the IP address.

fqdnRules.description: A list of FQDN rules applied to the connection.

username.description: The local target user or a personal user template

assignGroups.description: A list of groups that the local user is assigned to

enableEphemeralUserReconnect.description: Determines whether or not the ephemeral user can reconnect

InfrastructureVirtualMachineBehavior_con.description: A local user who is assigned to one or more groups
The profile that the policy members assume in order to connect to the target for each platform.

instances.description: The Database instances of the policy, a policy can have at most 1000 of either instances or databases inside instances
